question: I am going to marry a woman to get a citizenship of the country. Her interest in marriage is, I reward her with money and plus I have to sleep with her. My question is am I allowed to sleep with her as I am not going to marry her for real?
answer:
QUESTION

I am going to marry a woman to get a citizenship of the country. Her interest in marriage is, I reward her with money and plus I have to sleep with her. My question is am I allowed to sleep with her as I am not going to marry her for real?




ANSWER


Share:

In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalaamu `alaykum waRahmatullahi Wabarakatuh  

 

It is incorrect for you to marry a woman with the sole intention to receive citizenship of a country. Islam does not advocate such marriages, as they are generally temporary and provisional. These marriages are engineered to advance other agendas and are not performed with the intent to be permanent. You cannot simply ‘marry’ a woman, reward her with money and get to sleep with her. This is not the true spirit of marriage and Islam does not advocate this type of marriage.

Yes, if your marriage with a woman of another country is genuine and you intend a permanent marriage, then it will be permissible for you to marry her. The citizenship you will receive will be a bonus.

And Allah knows best

Wassalamu Alaikum

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
